required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Rate of En-masse Retraction in Orthodontic Patients With Maxillary Protrusion
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Rate of En-masse Retraction in Orthodontic Patients With Maxillary Protrusion Using Friction Versus Frictionless Mechanics: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: There's a scarcity in literature concerning en-masse retraction and its effect on the rate of tooth movement. The purpose of this study is to determine, In orthodontic patients with maxillary protrusion, which form of mechanics in en-masse retraction offers a faster rate of retraction; Friction or Frictionless Mechanics.

detailed_description.textblock: The en-masse technique can be done in one of two ways: through friction or frictionless mechanics. Both are viable options, but, ideally, we want to retract and complete the orthodontic treatment as quickly as possible, in order to decrease the negative effects that may occur during treatment. Which of these mechanics results in a decreased treatment time is still up for debate.

study_design_info.masking_description: Only the outcome assessors will be blind. The patients name will be sealed from pre and post radiographs and study models. Then two assessors will carry out, blindly and independently, the measurements and analysis of the study

primary_outcome.time_frame: From pre to post retraction (an average of 6 - 8 months)
primary_outcome.description: The antero-posterior movement of anterior teeth and first molars will be assessed by measuring the digitilized study models taken of the patients monthly (measured in mm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre to post retraction (an average of 6 - 8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Digitilized dental models taken before and after the completion of retraction will be measured by identifying landmarks and reference lines and planes (measured in mm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre to post retraction (an average of 6 - 8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Study models that are taken pre and post retraction (then digitilized) will be used to assess the rotation of the maxillary first molars in relation to a reference line (measurement of the angles in degrees)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre to post retraction/intervention (an average of 6 - 8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Each patient will fill a questionnaire regarding his treatment experience in a VAS scoring from 1-10

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre to post retraction (an average of 6 - 8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The principle investigator will examine pre and post lateral cephalometric radiographs in relation to lines and reference planes (measurements in degrees and mm)

arm_group.description: 6 anterior teeth (en-Masse) retracted using a crimpable hook distal to the upper lateral incisor and a power chain
6 anterior teeth (en-Masse) retracted using a T- loop

intervention.intervention_name: Power chain and Crimpable hook for En-Masse Retraction
intervention.description: Retraction will start on a 0.017"x0.025" Stainless steel wire using elastomeric chain (force applied will be 212 g per side) extending between the crimpable hooks and the miniscrew
Closing retraction T-loops will be fabricated using 0.017 x 0.025 TMA wire. The loop will be positioned halfway the extraction space and the canine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults and Adolescent patients (both genders)
- Age range (14-24)
- Patients with maxillary protrusion requiring first premolars extraction (Bimaxillary Protrusion or Class II division 1 cases).
- Patients with fully erupted permanent teeth (not necessarily including the third molar).
- Cases requiring maximum anchorage during retraction.
- Good general and oral health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients suffering from any systemic diseases interfering with tooth movement.
- Patients with extracted or missing permanent teeth. (except for third molars).
- Patients with badly decayed teeth.
- Patients with any parafunctional habits (i.e. Bruxism, tongue thrusting, mouth breathing, etcâ€¦).
- Patients with previous orthodontic treatment

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available after publication

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
